page.title: 09Religion.
page.content: St.Johns Church was built in 1835, originally as a chapel of ease and was openeed for worship on January 1st 1837.It is a small but neat stone structure without any attempt at architectural display.In the church are two stained glass windows to the memory of John Wilson esq. and his wife,installed by their son Thomas Wilson esq. of Shotley Hall in 1838 and 1842.Other stained glass windows in the church are dedicated to other past leading members of the community. The Chancel was extended in the early 1900's and ends in a five sided apse with stained glass windows. St.John's Church is controled by the Church of England,Corbridge Deanery, Newcastle Diocese.The area doees not have a Vicar but is served by a Priest in Charge,who is also a full_time teacher.His only concession from the
